sections.heading: Purpose of this screen
body: The Locations screen allows you to manage places where your plants are kept, such as rooms, balconies, or other areas.
Locations are used mainly to organize plants and to make filtering, sorting, and grouping easier across the app.

sections.heading: Location list
body: The screen displays a list of all locations defined by the user.
Locations can be predefined suggestions or fully custom names created by the user.
Each location shows how many plants are currently associated with it.

sections.heading: Location actions (3-dot menu)
body: Each location tile has a 3-dot menu with available actions.
You can edit the location name to better reflect where your plants are kept.
You can delete a location only if no plants are currently assigned to it.

sections.heading: Floating Action Button (FAB)
body: The FAB provides quick actions related to location management.
You can add a new location at any time.
Locations can be sorted by location name or by the number of plants assigned to each location.

sections.heading: How locations are used
body: Locations are used throughout the app to group plants logically.
They can be used as filters and sort criteria in views such as Plants, Reminders, and Task History.
Using locations helps keep plant collections organized, especially when managing a larger number of plants.
